title: Blessed axe

properties.name: description
properties.value: The blessed axe is an axe that is obtained during the Animal Magnetism quest (it can also be obtained after the quest). It can be made by combining a mithril axe with a holy symbol. It is used to chop undead twigs from the undead trees within the vicinity of Draynor Manor. If a replacement or a second one is needed, the player can get another one by speaking to Turael, who is located at Burthorpe. Note: If you need a replacement, another Mithril axe and Holy symbol are required.

The blessed axe is an axe that is obtained during the Animal Magnetism quest (it can also be obtained after the quest). It can be made by combining a mithril axe with a holy symbol. It is used to chop undead twigs from the undead trees within the vicinity of Draynor Manor. If a replacement or a second one is needed, the player can get another one by speaking to Turael, who is located at Burthorpe. Note: If you need a replacement, another Mithril axe and Holy symbol are required.

As the axe possesses a silver blade, it can damage vampyres.

The blessed axe does not retain the functionality of the mithril axe used to create it; it cannot be used to chop anything but undead trees. It does not require an Attack level to wield. The only statistical difference is the blessed axe has a +2 Prayer bonus the mithril axe does not.

[[File:Blessed axe detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''blessed axe''' is an axe that is obtained during the [[Animal Magnetism]] quest (it can also be obtained after the quest). It can be made by combining a [[mithril axe]] with a [[holy symbol]]. It is used to chop [[undead twigs]] from the undead trees within the vicinity of [[Draynor Manor]]. If a replacement or a second one is needed, the player can get another one by speaking to [[Turael]], who is located at [[Burthorpe]]. Note: If you need a replacement, another Mithril axe and Holy symbol are required. 

As the axe possesses a silver blade, it can damage [[vampyre]]s.

The blessed axe does not retain the functionality of the mithril axe used to create it; it cannot be used to chop anything but undead trees. It does not require an [[Attack]] level to wield. The only statistical difference is the blessed axe has a +2 [[Prayer]] bonus the mithril axe does not.
